title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 303.2 - Additional in-cell items
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 303.2 - Additional in-cell items

State Regulations

Upon request of each inmate, additional in-cell items
(provided they are not restricted by the issuance of a deprivation order in
accord with section
305.2
of this

Title) will be permitted as follows: (a) playing cards (one deck); (b) earphones (facility issue only, if cells
are equipped with a jack); Note: In facilities not equipped with jacks, inmates may be
allowed to have their personal radios/tape-players for use with an earplug, no
tapes permitted. Batteries may be purchased from the commissary. (c) books, magazines or newspapers
(not to exceed a total of 10 per inmate in the cell, excluding legal
publications); (d) photos
(personal, additional 10, not to exceed a total of 20 per inmate in the cell, no frames/albums); (e) stamps; (f) skin cream, 1 oz. size. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7
ยง
303.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
